revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Ubee |model=DVW323B |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=05/23/2013 |manuf_country= |manuf=Foxconn |manuf_model=U10C071 |manuf_rev=.11 |availability= |type=wireless eMTA,cable modem,analog phone gateway |fcc_id=XCNDXW3WB |ic_id= |pwr_v=120 |pwr_amp=0.9 |pwr_conn=C7P |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac=true |pwr_ac_hz=60 |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM3383 |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=128 |ram1_brand=Samsung |ram1_model=K4B1G1646G-BCH9 |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num=1 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4331 |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=3 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=3 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi2_chip1_model=BCM4331 |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=3 |wi2_rxchains=3 |wi2_sstreams=3 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Broadcom |sw_model= |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports= |flags=MoCA 2.0 |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ssid=DVW323BXX,DVW323BXX-5G |default_ssid_regex=^DVW323B[A-Fa-f0-9]{2}$,,,^DVW323B[A-Fa-f0-9]{2}-5G$ |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui= |oui_eth= }} The FCC test report indicates that the following models are covered by the FCC ID used in this entry. *DVW323 - with VoIP and MoCA (optional battery) **appears to be board model U10C072.11 *DDW364 - without VoIP, with MoCA **appears to be board model U10C071.10 *DVW328 - with VoIP, without MoCA (optional battery) **appears to be board model U10C081.81 *DDW366 - without VoIP and MoCA **appears to be board model U10C082.80
Per the FCC photos, this device is using... *a '''Broadcom''' BCM3383 (BCM3383GKFEBG) Cable Modem SoC *two '''Broadcom''' BCM4331 (BCM4331KMLG) Wi-Fi radios **w/ [http://www.skyworksinc.com/Product.aspx?ProductID=971 3x '''Skyworks ('''SiGe''') SE5005L (5005L) 5GHz Power Amplifier ICs] for the 5GHz radio **w/ [http://www.skyworksinc.com/Product.aspx?ProductID=963 3x '''Skyworks ('''SiGe''') SE2604L (2604L) 2.4GHz Power Amplifier ICs] for the 2.4GHz radio *an [http://www.entropic.com/solutions/cable/cable-moca-solutions/en2710-en1410 '''Entropic Communications''' EN2710 (EN2710-LG2) MoCA 2.0 controller] w/ accompanying EN1410K4 *a '''SMP''' SMPCM10 modular Li-ion battery (7.4VDC, 2.4Ahr 18.87Wh) *an integrated '''Chicony Electronics''' power supply (checkboxes for N026R001L and N035R001L appear to be silkscreened on the PSU board)
The FCC sample sample indicates the default SSID patterns for this model is '''DVW323BXX''' and '''DVW323BXX-5G''' (with '''XX''' being the last two digits of the Cable RF MAC Address). :The default SSID patterns for the other device seem to be... :*DDW364: '''DDW364XX''' and '''DDW364XX-5G''' :*DDW366: '''DDW366.XXXXXX-2.4G''' and '''DDW366.XXXXXX-5G''' ('''XXXXXX''' = last 6 digits of the Wi-Fi MAC) :*DVW328: '''DVW328.XXXXXX-2.4G''' and '''DVW328.XXXXXX-5G''' ('''XXXXXX''' = last 6 digits of the Wi-Fi MAC)
